data.title: turn on Route 1 causes crash
data.meta_description: A 50-year-old Mansfield man died after he allegedly attempted a U-turn from the center lane on Route 1 in Wrentham, causing a vehicle in the far-left lane to crash into the the car the man was driving early Friday evening, according to State Police.
data.text:
A 50-year-old Mansfield man died after he allegedly attempted a U-turn from the center lane on Route 1 in Wrentham, causing a vehicle in the far-left lane to crash into the the car the man was driving early Friday evening, according to State Police.

State troopers responded at about 5:30 p.m. to the crash, which investigators believe occurred after a 2014 Mercedes CLA sedan driven by the Mansfield man attempted a sudden U-turn and was struck on its driverâ€™s side by a second vehicle also headed north near 475 Washington St., according to a statement from State Police.

The Mansfield man, whose name was not released, suffered serious injuries and was taken to a nearby hospital, where he was pronounced dead, according to the statement. The other driver involved in the crash reported no injuries.

Advertisement

The crash remains under investigation by State Police.

Kajsa Kedefors can be reached at kajsa.kedefors@globe.com.
